t: Center for Japanese Studies (CJS) | U-M LSA Center for Japanese Studies (CJS)

t: Beginning Japanese 1 | College in the Schools - U of M
s: This course is the first of a two-semester sequence of Beginning Japanese; it is for students who have no previous knowledge of Japanese. It aims to begin the development of communication skills in Japanese from True Beginner to the Novice Mid or Novice High level of the guidelines set by ACTFL.

t: Study Abroad | U-M LSA Center for Japanese Studies (CJS)
s: The first Japanese students to study at the University of Michigan arrived in Ann Arbor in 1873. Today, over 140 years later, U-M and the Center for Japanese Studies offer a wide variety of study abroad programs in Japan, ranging from 3-4 week spring/summer experiential courses led by CJS faculty ...
